title: 114_hr5879
content: MODIFICATIONS OF CREDIT FOR PRODUCTION FROM ADVANCED NUCLEAR POWER FACILITIES. The amendment to Section 45J(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes the allocation of unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. This allocation prioritizes facilities placed in service before that date that did not receive a full nameplate capacity allocation. The amendment allocates unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. This prioritizes facilities placed in service before that date that did not receive full nameplate capacity allocation. The unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation is defined as the excess of 6,000 megawatts over the aggregate amount allocated before January 1, 2021. The Secretary allocates unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation after December 31, 2020. This prioritizes facilities placed in service before that date that did not receive full nameplate capacity allocation. The excess of 6,000 megawatts over the aggregate amount allocated before January 1, 2021 is defined as unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation. Coordination with other provisions is specified for such allocations. The section discusses the allocation of national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary, prioritizing facilities placed in service before December 31, 2020. It also addresses the transfer of credits by certain public entities under Section 45J of the Code. The subsection discusses the transfer of credits by qualified public entities under Section 45J of the Code. If a qualified public entity elects, the eligible project partner will be treated as the taxpayer for the credit. The curr_chunk discusses the definitions of a qualified public entity and eligible project partner for the purpose of transferring credits under Section 45J of the Code. The curr_chunk defines an eligible project partner as a person involved in the design, construction, or provision of components for an advanced nuclear power facility receiving credits under Section 45J of the Code. The curr_chunk discusses the eligibility criteria for receiving credits under Section 45J of the Code for an advanced nuclear power facility. It includes provisions for individuals involved in providing nuclear fuel, owning an interest in the facility, and special rules for partnerships. For purposes of Section 45J credits, a qualified public entity is treated as the taxpayer for its share of the credit, and any partner of the partnership is considered an eligible project partner. The credit is taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner following the qualified public entity's taxable year in which the credit was determined. The Section 45J credits treat a qualified public entity as the taxpayer for its share of the credit, with any partner of the partnership considered an eligible project partner. The credit is accounted for in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner following the qualified public entity's taxable year in which the credit was determined. Additionally, any benefit derived by an eligible project partner in connection with an election under this subsection is not considered a private business use for purposes of section 141(b)(1). The amendment to Section 501(c)(12) of the Code allows income from a mutual or cooperative electric company to be treated as collected from members for meeting losses and expenses. The effective dates for the amendments are upon enactment and for taxable years starting after December 31, 2016. The amendment made by subsection (a) will take effect upon enactment of this Act, while the amendments made by subsection (b) will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2016.
